I would recommend 'The Amazing Spider-Man'. It is a superhero movie that stars Andrew Garfield as Peter Parker and Emma Stone as Gwen Stacey. The movie follows Peter Parker after he gets bitten by a genetically altered spider. He gains newfound, spider- like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.
Another option could be 'American Dreamz'. It is another superhero movie that stars John McMartin as Peter Parker and Nancy Allen as Gwen Stacey. The movie follows Peter Parker after he gets bitten by a genetically altered spider. He gains newfound, spider- like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.
Both these movies are well-made with strong performances from the lead actors. They also have interesting storylines that keep the audience engaged throughout the movie. I would recommend both 'The Amazing Spider-Man' and 'American Dreamz' to anyone who is looking for some good superhero movies to watch.

conversation.text:
Based on your preferences, here are some recommendations:

- "JFK" is a historical drama film based on the stage play of the same name by Ron Goldman. The film stars Tom Cruise as President John F. Kennedy and Mark Rylance as James Lee Jones, who is the head of the Warren Commission. The film tells the story of Kennedy's assassination in Dallas, Texas on November 22, 1963. The film received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike.

- "Why Did I Get Married?" is a romantic comedy film directed by Anne Heche. The film stars Jennifer Aniston as Jane Farthing, who is a successful businesswoman living in New York City with her best friend and confidant, Sarah, played by Sarah Jessica Parker. The film tells the story of Jane's wedding to a wealthy businessman named Harry, played by Ben Affleck. However, just before the wedding ceremony takes place, Harry suddenly disappears without any trace, leaving Jane and Sarah shocked and baffled.

conversation.text:
Based on the user's preference cues, here are some potential recommendations:
1. "Prometheus" (2012) directed by Adam Green. This movie follows a contemporary quest story set in end-of-millennium Britain and continental Europe. The plot asks what humanity has made of Prometheus' gift of fire - energy, technology, expertise, but also destruction, pollution and war.
2. "Lady in the Water" (2007) directed by Kevin Smith. This movie tells a story about trials of marriage and what happens to one family when a sexy young temptress arrives on the scene. The plot asks what happens after the trials of marriage are over.
3. "Passion" (2011) directed by Malik Yoba. This movie is based on a 6 minute narrative doc that follows Jack Passion, a man who has defied social convention and become an ambassador for the sport of competitive beard growing. Through good times and bad, he has pushed on to become the two time world beard champion. He shares this inspirational story with us and guides us through his world in a 6 minute narrative doc.
4. "Why Did I Get Married?" (2007) directed by Kevin Smith. This movie tells a story about trials of marriage and what happens to one family when a sexy young temptress arrives on the scene. The plot asks what happens after the trials of marriage are over.
